text.text: Archimedes is a line of 32-bit computers manufactured by Acorn in 1987. It was the first consumer ARM computer, with ARM standing for 'Acorn Risc Machine' before becoming 'Advanced Risc Machines'. It was superior in power to rivals such as the Atari ST, Amiga 500, PC and Apple at the time. The first model was equipped with an 8 Mhz processor and 512 kB of RAM. The last in 1992 offered a 40 Mhz, 4 Mb of RAM and 80 Mb of hard disk. It displays a resolution ranging from 640x512 in 256 colors, to 1600x600 in 16 colors and has stereo sound on 8 channels.
